items.title: Arsenal still in control of title race; Liverpool show they need to improve
items.summary: Both Arsenal and Liverpool settled for a point in a scoreless draw, but it was a missed opportunity for the Gunners to extend their lead in the Premier League.

items.title: Kluivert hoopt na succesvolle operatie op WK-deelname met Oranje
items.summary: Justin Kluivert heeft WK-deelname met het Nederlands elftal nog niet uit zijn hoofd gezet. De aanvallende middenvelder van Bournemouth is donderdag met succes geopereerd aan zijn linkerknie en is hoopvol gestemd, laat hij weten aan De Telegraaf .

items.title: 'Liverpool liet weer eens een keer zien dat ze de kampioen zijn'
items.summary: Liverpool heeft indruk gemaakt in Engeland tijdens het doelpuntloze gelijkspel tegen Premier League-koploper Arsenal . Over de landstitel wil het team van manager Arne Slot niet praten na een slechte serie, maar in het Emirates Stadium speelde Liverpool in ieder geval als een kampioen.

items.title: Xabi Alonso hekelt uitspraken van 'onsportieve' Simeone
items.summary: 'Vini, Vini. Onthoud wat ik je zeg, Florentino (P√©rez, red.) gaat ervoor zorgen dat je weg moet.' De Spaanse liplezers waren er snel over uit, dit zou Atl√©tico Madrid-trainer Diego Simeone naar Vin√≠cius J√∫nior hebben geschreeuwd in de openingsfase van de wedstrijd tussen Atl√©ti en Real Madrid in de halve finale van de Super Cup . Zelf wilde Simeone er niet op reageren , Real Madrid-coach Xabi Alonso was niet te spreken over de uitspraken van zijn collega.

items.title: Liverpool criticize Martinelli, fear for Bradley injury
items.summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot said Gabriel Martinelli's push on an injured Conor Bradley in his side's 0-0 draw with Arsenal on Thursday "doesn't look great," adding that he feared for the extent of Bradley's injury.

items.title: Martinelli 'deeply sorry' for shoving injured Bradley

items.title: FA Cup third round: 10 things to look out for this weekend
items.summary: Macclesfield and Weston-super-Mare carry the non-league hopes while fringe players need to seize their chances Silly goals conceded, chances missed, a lead surrendered and points squandered against relegation fodder. On the face of things, Manchester United have changed manager but nothing else. The reality is different. They started slowly at Burnley, settling into a 4-2-3-1 formation that suits them ‚Äì and pretty much every other team ‚Äì far better than Ruben Amorim‚Äôs 3-4-2-1 before, midway through the first half, they started to play. The deployment of Bruno Fernandes close to the opposition goal, along with a wide player, Patrick Dorgu, playing on his natural side, meant Benjamin Sesko was, for the first time, provided with decent service. Then, following Jaidon Anthony‚Äôs equaliser, Darren Fletcher‚Äôs side risked defeat by going all out for the win ‚Äì one nearly achieved through the timely introduction of Shea Lacey, a richly talented 18-year-old. Brighton will present far stiffer opposition but, for the first time in a long time, United are doing what United are meant to do. Daniel Harris Manchester United v Brighton, Sunday 4.30pm (all GMT) Macclesfield v Crystal Palace, Saturday 12.15pm Grimsby v Weston-super-Mare, Saturday 5.45pm Manchester City v Exeter, Saturday 3pm Continue reading...

items.title: Kyrgios not ready to play singles at Australian Open
items.summary: Nick Kyrgios admits he is not ready to play singles at the Australian Open and will instead focus on the doubles event alongside his partner Thanasi Kokkinakis.

items.title: Return of the Emirates Groan: Arsenal fans restless on night of stalemate with Liverpool | Jonathan Liew
items.summary: Only one club are sitting pretty at the top of the Premier League, but the supporters‚Äô anxiety after 22 years without the title risks infecting the players Full-time and handshakes. A little Tears for Fears tinkles over the public address system. Beyond that ‚Ä¶ what, exactly? How to describe this swirling, velvety anti-noise? The sound of no gloves clapping? The sound of time physically disappearing down a vortex? The sound of no emotions? It began with North London Forever and by the end we felt as though we had been in north London for ever: stuck on an endless loop of William Saliba passing to Jurri√´n Timber, of Virgil van Dijk pausing as he tried to bait a press that would never come. Long periods of this game were played at literal walking pace. Continue reading...
